title: Conditional Probability Formula
text: The conditional probability of A given B may be computed by means of the following formula: P(A$$\mid$$B)=P(A$$∩$$B)/P(B)

title: P(Chocolate and Strawberry)
text: What is the probability that a randomly chosen friend likes both chocolate AND strawberry? Enter you answer rounded to 2 decimal places

subHints.title: P(Chocolate and Strawberry)
subHints.text: 35% of your friends like chocolate AND like strawberry. Thus the probability that a randomly chosen friend likes both is 0.35

title: P(Chocolate)
text: What is the probability that a randomly chosen friend likes chocolate? Enter you answer rounded to 2 decimal places

subHints.title: P(Chocolate)
subHints.text: 70% of your friends like chocolate. Thus the probability that a randomly chosen friend likes chocolate is 0.70

title: P(Strawberry$$\mid$$Chocolate)
text: Using the conditional probability formula, calculate P(Strawberry$$\mid$$Chocolate) using P(Chocolate and Strawberry) and P(Chocolate)
